text: MOLLY (18, hardcore, sleeps with a titanium biteguard) MEDITATES as she listens to a MOTIVATIONAL TAPE.

Good morning, winner. Take a deep breath. (takes a deep breath) Good. You're ready to dominate this day. Her small bedroom is crammed with textbooks, notebooks, r books, academic awards. MOTIVATIONAL VOICE (0.S.) (CONT’D) You've worked harder than everyone, and that is why you’re a champion. Photos of women like Michelle Obama, RBG, Susan B. Anthon and Gloria Steinham line her bookshelves. MOTIVATIONAL VOICE (0.S.) (CONT’D) You understand that greatness takes sacrifice. Visualize what you still want to achieve. A “Valedictorian” ribbon lays across a graduation gown hanging on her mirror. MOTIVATIONAL VOICE (0.S.) (CONT’D) Stand upon the mountain of your success and look down at everyone who’s ever doubted you. (a beat) Fuck those losers. Fuck them in their stupid, fucking faces. Molly's eyes pop open. She removes her biteguard. INT. AMY'S CAR - DAY/EXT. MOLLY’S APARTMENT BUILDING - DA Amy (18, a big-hearted social justice warrior) pulls up t Molly's building, honking just as Molly comes outside-- t have this timed perfectly. Molly does a little dance for as she walks to the car.
Oh shit. Oooh, shit. Look at her go. Hold the phone. I’m coming... (CONTINUED )
Amy gets out of the car and starts DANCING WITH MOLLY on sidewalk. They dance for a long, long beat.
I missed you.
I missed you. So much.
It’s been one night. They just keep dancing.
Are we gonna go to school, or...
I don’t think we are.
Nope, we're just gonna stay right...here.
Amy's rickety Volvo pulls up to their high school, alread buzzing with RAMBUNCTIOUS, GIDDY STUDENTS practically vibrating with last-day-energy.

The courtyard BUZZES with LOUD, Everybody's shrieking or laughing or crying with their friends. Molly and Amy walk through like salmon swimming upstream, dodging SKATEBOARD They pass an EMOTIONAL GIRL crying with her friends--
I mean these were the best four years of our lives! Molly gives Amy a look.
Can you imagine a world in which these were actually the best four years of our lives? (CONTINUED )

Maybe if I immediately lost all my limbs, and my eyesight and hearing, and I was just like a human potato. I'd be like, “remember when I had my limbs and could see and hear? Those were the best four years.”
Or if I was convicted of a crime I didn’t commit and spent the rest of my life in a Thai prison.
If I spent the rest of my life reading in the backseat of a car.

You do get so carsick. They walk INSIDE, where it’s even rowdier. Molly pushes h way through the chaos-- MOLLY (CONT’D) Where was this energy at my inauguration assembly, folks?! INT. PRINCIPAL BROWN’S OFFICE - DAY Molly and Amy stop outside PRINCIPAL BROWN’s office as he finishes the morning announcements on a PA SYSTEM.

...and please do not attempt a senior prank. I have eyes and ears every where and you will not succeed. I don’t wanna have to suspend you right before graduation. I hope I never have to see any of you again. All right, signing off. Gooooo Crocketts! He turns off the PA system, putting it away, when--
Principal Brown.
("kill me”) Molly. Amy. What’s shaking? (CONTINUED )
He stands
I’m trying to make the transition to next year’s student government President as seamless as possible so when I’m up in New Haven--
Yale. You can say just Yale.
Our class's official policy is to not discuss where people are attending next year. We don’t want anyone to feel insecure.
Very thoughtful.
Anyway, I need to go over the end- of-year budget numbers we have.
Really? Can’t you just do it with Nick? He’s your Vice President.
We both know Nick only ran for VP because they plan the dances. That position is basically a popularity contest. He’s useless.

Ladies, it’s the last day. We did it! We got you through high school. and walks over to them. PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D) Can’t we just graduate? Head off to college? Celebrate this wonderful achievement? He starts slowly closing the door. PRINCIPAL BROWN (CONT’D) Let’s just focus on getting through the rest of the day without anything horrible happening, okay?
I’m sorry, are you shutting the door on us? This isn’t subtle. (MORE ) (CONTINUED )
You can’t just close the door. We will persist-- He shuts it in their faces.

Molly and Amy walk back down the hallway. Amy watches as NICK holds court with his friends TANNER and THEO and a T OF GIRLS all trying to flirt with him. Nick RAMS his head into his locker, popping it open. Everyone laughs.
It is kinda impressive. Nick’s like the great equalizer. Delegates from every group of girls are casting their ballots for his penis. A HOT GIRL, TRIPLE A, giggles at Nick, touching his chest
And Triple A takes the lead!
Don’t call her that.
Everyone calls her that. She gave “roadside assistance” to three senior guys last year.
And do you hear them getting degrading nicknames?
They call Sam Ross “Dick Splinter.”

That’s not derogatory. It’s a factual description. Sam Ross had an actual splinter in his penis. INT. MISS FINE’S CLASSROOM - DAY Molly and Amy walk up to MISS FINE (30, their teacher cru sitting at the teacher’s desk.
Hi Miss Fine! (CONTINUED )
Miss Fine holds up a completed NY TIMES CROSSWORD.
Seven minutes twenty seconds. Molly and Amy groan and hold up the SAME CROSSWORD.
Nine forty-three.
What am I gonna do without you two next year? Nobody else here even attempts the Thursday puzzle.
We'll still send you our Sunday times. Amy and I are gonna Skype the crossword every weekend.

You know what? I’m gonna give you guys my number. If you have any questions or need anything next year, text me. They try to play it cool, but this is the best moment of their lives. They each try to hand her their own phone, b Molly boxes Amy out and gets hers into Miss Fine’s hands. Triple A walks in and rolls her eyes--
I thought phones weren’t allowed in class, Miss Fine. Unless there’s an exception for ass kissers?
You better put a dollar in the swear jar. (holding out her hand) The swear jar is my hand. Give me a dollar. Triple A shrugs innocently.
I’m so sorry, these shorts don’t have pockets. GEORGE and ALAN, two magnificently dramatic theater kids, push their way toward their seats-- (CONTINUED )
(as he sits) There is no spacial awareness at this school... Molly and Amy squeal over Miss Fine’s number as they sett into their desks. HOPE (gorgeous, intimidating) watches.
Hey, Amy. (Amy turns) Did you just score your teacher's phone number?
Yeah!
(fatally sarcastically) Nice. Hope smirks at her and settles back into her seat. Amy frowns, stung. Theo and Tanner drop into their seats behind Molly and Am Theo calls up to Miss Fine--
Miss Fine, you gonna come party with us tonight?
Did you just ask Miss Fine if she wants to party with you? You think she wants to watch you and your friends get drunk and break things?
Sorry, I was having a conversation with her, you were not a part of this--
Sit down, Theo. Theo glares but sits just as sweet, eager JARED (18) walk in. He’s decked out in the most expensive stuff possible, tries too hard to ever be truly cool. (CONTINUED )
What up Miss Fine! Just wanted to drop off a last-day present for my favorite teach!
Jared, you are not my student.

I've heard great things. (to the class) And everybody else got their graduation gifts, right? He shows off the shirt he’s wearing: a series of photos o his face inside his face inside his face. He steals
Pretty cool, right? Jare-bear coming at you from all angles.
Nobody asked for that.
(playing with the shirt) Big me, littler me, little baby Jare at the bottom. Baby Jare says “happy graduation, everybody!”
Nobody’s gonna wear a shirt with your face on it, Jared. Not even ironically.
Well, agree to disagree, because they’re out in the cafeteria now--
Jared! Go!
I’m gone. I’m out of here. (then, quickly) Bye Molly. one last look at Molly and hurries away as George and Alan jump on the makeshift STAGE at the front of the room. (CONTINUED )
Fair townspeople. (no reaction) Fair townspeople!

head_text.subj: FAIR TOWNSPEOPLE, I SWEAR TO GOD.

text: Mark thy calendars and plan thy trip to the Drama Department’s summer program: Shakespeare in the Park-ing Lot.

We'll be performing the Bard's comedies as modern tragedies outside Whole Foods across town! (very pleased with himself) It’s something we did last year in my program in Barthelona. When I lived in Barthelona. Molly closes her eyes, too annoyed to retort.
I'll be directing and Alan may be starring pending auditions.
I do not audition, I am offer only. They hop off the stage and start handing out flyers.
It sounds awesome, but I won’t be here.
Amy's spending the summer in Botswana helping women make their own tampons.
Gross.
Blood attracts lions. I’m saving lives. (CONTINUED )
And I can’t either because I’m working all summer and also I don’t want to.
You are a philistine.
Who would do theater when you could do debate?
Some of us know how to play well with others.
And some of us know how to win.
Nobody's winning in that outfit. George glares at her as Miss Fine stands and CLAPS her ha
Get in those seats. We still have one day of school left. Molly, why don’t you start us off. Molly stands as the rest of the class GROANS.
Thank you, Ms. Fine. If you guys recall how I ended yesterday... Amy sits back to watch, adoringly, as her best friend presents to the class.
Molly walks her lunch past Nick as he’s trying to catch c Theo’s throwing in his mouth. She approaches him.
Nick--
One second.
Nick, we need to finalize the budget. Can you focus for 2 secon-- (CONTINUED )
He misses a chip, laughing. MOLLY (CONT’D) Nick I really need your--
Sorry, we're playing a game where I’ve gotta catch it in my mouth, it’s complicated.

Yes, it looks super complicated. Molly gives up and walks over to Amy sitting at a table. MOLLY (CONT’D) I can’t believe I had to put up with Nick as my VP for a whole year. He’s allergic to work. He just goofs off and dicks around-- Molly realizes Amy isn’t listening-- she’s staring off at beautiful SKATER doing tricks with her friends. MOLLY (CONT’D) Just go talk to Ryan.
Oh, no. No thank you. I’m good.
Cool. Then I’ll go talk to Ryan. Molly moves like she’s going to dash over and Amy jumps t her feet. Molly gives her a look.

Fine! Fine. Amy takes a deep breath and psychs herself up as she walk over there. She’s so distracted by the psyching of hersel up that she doesn’t notice Ryan start to skate away and S right into her, knocking her off her board.
Oh my god Ryan, I’m so sorry!
(laughing) You’re got some sharp elbows. (CONTINUED )
Not as sharp as your...chin. (an awkward beat) Can you believe it’s the last day?
I know, it’s crazy. You don’t have to waste your free periods tutoring me French anymore.
(blushing) I didn’t mind. It was my job.
Hey, are you coming to Nick’s tonight? His aunt’s on a cruise ship that broke down and everyone got norovirus so he’s having a party at her house.
That sounds so cool.
No, it’s super bad. They’re all shitting in buckets and they’re stuck on a boat.
No I meant-- never mind. Ryan laughs. Amy laughs, too, not really sure why. Then a rides by between them and Amy panics and uses the distrac to hurry back to Molly.
What are you doing? Go back!
It’s fine. Really. I don’t even know if she’s into girls.
She wore a polo shirt to prom.
That’s just her gender performance, not her sexual orientation.
I’m sorry, but I don’t get it. (CONTINUED )
Well gender is a construct of--

That much I understand, thank you. It’s just a little bit shocking that you’re into Ryan. Your first crush was the little white cat from the Aristocats. You go from that to Avril Lavigne...it’s just not what I anticipated.
I just like that she’s always in a good mood. And her cute laugh. She seems like a fun person to have sleepovers and lie around with.
Excuse me? I’m a fun person to have sleepovers and lie around with. That’s literally all we do.
Yeah but with her there’d be more...vagina involved. Amy watches longingly as Ryan laughs with some OTHER GIRL
She said Nick’s having a party tonight.

Of course he would. He’s so stupid. Someone always gets arrested the night before graduation. Molly sees Amy watching and puts her arm around her. MOLLY (CONT’D) Amy do you know how many cute lesbians are going to be crawling up your vag at Columbia next year? Every time I come to visit you’re gonna be scissoring a different girl. You’re gonna be like Edward Scissor-Legs. Snipping left and right...
Dude, we’ve been over this. Scissoring is not a thing. (CONTINUED )
How bout we don’t knock it til we try it?
As a CLASSIC 70's MUSCLE CAR screeches past them and into spot in the student lot. Amy shakes her head, annoyed.
Here comes the one percent. Jared's driving and GIGI (18, gorgeous, wild) leans out o the passenger seat, her hair in the wind.
That car should be in a museum. The Museum of Death. Because its smog is killing us all. Jared parks and Gigi turns, confused--
Jared, I said door to door!
They spend every minute together. It’s so weird.
We spend every minute together.
But we’re equals. Gigi’s just keeping Jared around for when she needs a liver. They watch Gigi start crawling up Jared’s windshield.
You think it’s true his dad got him a sex worker for his 14th birthday?
It’s too weird of a story to make up. And there were too many specifics. She had a hearing aid, he sprained his ankle... Jared notices them staring and waves-- (CONTINUED )
(then) You guys hungry? I brought back some soup dumps! They’re probably a little soggy now, but they’re great cold!
Oh, God. I’m going to pee in your weirdass bathroom, watch my stuff.
(calling after her) Until all of us can pee without genitals, none of us can!
Molly is peeing in a stall when she notices graffiti on t wall: “your ugly.” She takes grammar as
These motherfuckers. Your ugly what? a pen from her pocket and corrects the graffiti’s THEO and TANNER enter the bathroom, mid- conversation. In her sta
Okay, so, I'd marry the sex doll, fuck the soccer ball, and kill Molly.
(laughing) Dude, no. 11, Molly FREEZES.

There’s no other way. I can’t fuck her cause you know when I’m scared I can’t get hard. I can’t marry her cause I don’t believe in the institution. I have to kill Molly. And I know it’1l haunt me. I'ma peaceful person. Outside, another stall door opens and TRIPLE A emerges. (CONTINUED )
Are you talking about Molly Davidson? That girl is so weird. She always acts like she’s like, forty.
I wish she was forty, man. Women in their forties know themselves.
She’s cute, but she’d probably make you quiz her on SAT analogies while you're fucking her.
Her vag is probably stuffed with diplomas, how you wanna bet? I bet it’s like a filing cabinet.
I’ve got no problem with a filing cabinet. I would make passionate sex to Molly Davidson. (a beat) I'd just put a bag over her personality.

Molly's like a Butterface for personality. A Butterpersonality. They all laugh. In the stall, Molly’s trying not to cry. takes a deep breath -- and then she sets her jaw, stands walks out. Everyone stops, awkward.

Don’t stop on my account. Cause you know what? My vag is stuffed with diplomas, and soon it’s going to be stuffed with job offers, and glowing profiles, and commendations from my governor, because while you were studying for AP Hand Jobs I was kicking ass and busting curves. And that means I get to keep doing that at Yale next year. So, yeah, I like my choices. And wherever you are next year, I hope you do too. A beat. Molly's kind of impressed with herself. That spee was fucking awesome. Until-- (CONTINUED )
I’m going to Yale, too. Molly just stares at her for a moment.
What?
I'm incredible at hand jobs. But I also got a 1560 on the SATs.
No you didn’t.
I got in early.
To Yale?
(innocently) Tanner, where are you going to school?
I’m playing soccer at Stanford.
Stanford University? What are you guys talking about?
I’m not going to college. (then) I got recruited to code for Google. It’s not Apple but the bennies are tight and it’s mid six-figures.
You failed the seventh grade twice.
(shrugging) Rule of threes. Molly looks between them, realizing--
You guys are being serious? (CONTINUED )
I may pretend I don’t know you next year. No offense.
That’s not-- you’re not-- This isn’t possible. You guys don’t even care about school.
No, we just don’t only care about school. A kernel of panic starts growing in Molly’s stomach.
Molly marches out of the bathroom. She runs into Amy, who notices Molly’s face--
What’s wrong? Molly sees Nick running past them and grabs him.
Nick, where are you going next year?
For college? I thought the whole thing was that we weren’t supp--
Georgetown, jeez. Amy's surprised. Nick just takes off again. Molly sees Ho adjusting her makeup in the reflection of a trophy case--
Hope, where are y--
I couldn’t be less interested in whatever's happening here. Molly just keeps marching down the hall toward Gigi. (CONTINUED )
Gigi! Quick question. Where are you going to school next year?

Don’t judge me. It was my fifth choice. (then, disappointed) Harvard. That’s it. Molly’s head explodes, just as the BELL RINGS, people flood out of class, and Nick comes back around the corner, raising his arms--—
He puts on a SNORKEL as he and his friends pull out_bucke of CONDOM WATER BALLOONS and start throwing them everywhe

Suddenly it’s total joyful chaos. Colorful splashes explo everywhere. Two SKATERS ride down the hallway spraying FI EXTINGUISHERS. Everybody’s shrieking and laughing and hav the time of their life -- except for Molly. In SLOW-MOTION a CONDOM WATER BALLOON flies through the a and EXPLODES on Molly’s face, and we CUT TO....
Amy drives a silent, soaking wet Molly.
Molly leans against a well-worn PICNIC TABLE, in shock. A set out a CAKE and a MEMORY BOX and is playing an AUTO-HA making up a song to try to cheer Molly up.
If you don’t say something in the next ten minutes / I’m gonna take you to the hospital / I don’t wanna say I’m getting concerned / But to be honest I’m getting concerned--
Triple A?! Fucking Triple A?! This is FUCKED. Amy slides away the auto-harp. (CONTINUED )
Ok, that’s obviously not helping...
We chose. We didn’t party because we wanted to focus on school and get into good colleges.
And it worked.
But the irresponsible people who partied also got into good colleges! They did both!
So?
So we messed up! We didn’t have to choose! They did both and we’re the only assholes who did one!
We’re not assholes! Let’s just have some cake and celebrate the end--
This is not a time to celebrate. (turning back to Amy) We have to go to a party tonight.
What?
Let’s go to Nick’s party.
Are you kidding? No way.

We only have one night left to have studied and partied in high school. Otherwise we’ll always be the girls who missed out. We never made out with strangers or snuck out and had to sneak home without waking up our parents or broke any rules!
We broke rules! We have fake IDs. (CONTINUED )
Fake college IDs so we could get into their 24-hour library!
That counts. Plus, what’s so great about breaking rules? Name one person whose life was better cause they broke rules.
Picasso.
That’s not-- he broke art rules. Name someone who broke a real rule--
Rosa Parks.
(a beat) Name anoth--
Susan B. Anthony.
Goddamnit.

I’m serious, Amy. Everyone thinks we're these robots. They think all we care about is taking a million APs and getting into Yale and editing Law Review at Georgetown and clerking for a Federal Judge between Junior and Senior Year before eventually being the youngest justice ever nominated to the Supreme Court of the United States! (then, awkwardly) In my case. You get my point. No one knows we can be fun too.
We do. We know.
(intense) They need to know. (CONTINUED )
Who's “they?”
We’re not one-dimensional. We're smart and fun. We have to do this.
This is crazy. We graduate tomorrow. What if we get in trouble?
You know we’re too smart for that. Plus Ryan wanted you to come. She’s gonna be there and you’re finally gonna make a move.
(flustered) What? That-- She-- no. Molly sits next to Amy.

You've been out for two years and you've never kissed a girl. I want you to experience this. (intense) And what will I be doing during that time? I’m going to experience a seminal fun anecdote, and we're gonna change our stories. Forever. Amy's cracking.
We were gonna watch that Ken Burns thing... Molly knows she’s got her. She jumps up, pumped--
The Dust Bowl can wait, bitch! What took them four years, we’re gonna do in one night. She’s so pumped that she grabs the cake and TOSSES IT off hill. MUSIC’S UP as we CUT TO...  23.

A cozy flurry of protest signs, books, and photos of lady heroes like Gloria Steinem and Jane Goodall. Molly and Am burst inside and begin getting ready to go out: --Molly throws open a drawer labelled “MOLLY,” full of he clothes, looking for an outfit. --Molly and Amy admire each other’s OUTFITS:
No. Not acceptable.
Nope. This is not okay.
Who allowed you to be this beautiful?
Who allowed you to be this beautiful?
Who allowed you to take? My breath? Away?
Call the paramedics, all the police, because there has been an

You are STUNNING. I HAVE NO BREATH-- --Molly and Amy watch a YOUTUBE refresher on self-defense moves. They practice the GRIP ESCAPE MOVE. --Molly stuffs a copy of her passport and their fake UCLA in a HIDDEN MONEY BELT people use when traveling abroad. --Amy twists a MACE KEYCHAIN on her keys, demonstrating h it works to Molly:
Okay, this is important. Always make sure the safety is on-- SPPPP. It sprays mace. Molly screams. Amy screams-- (CONTINUED )
The safety’s not on! Don’t touch your eyes!
Amy puts some finishing touches on her outfit. She looks and sees Molly writing something at her desk.
What are y-- are you making a checklist for a night of partying?

Of course I am. (going over it) Killer outfits, safety tutorial, check check. Get address, secure safe transportation, you find Ryan, flirt for 15-20 minutes, bring her somewhere more quiet, ride her like a pony, I prove I’m fun, home by 1.
Are you gonna hook up with anybody? Molly scoffs very loudly.
No. No way. High school boys are just horny, pimply distractions. Men don’t even come online til they’re 28 and then they don’t peak til they’re like 40. I’m holding out for an Econ TA next year.
If Ryan wants to go further than making out, I have no idea what to do...down there.
Of course you do. You have the same parts she does, just take whatever you do to yourself and turn it upside down.
(reddening) I don’t really do anything... (CONTINUED )
Guys talk about this stuff all the time! It’s honestly offensive that we don’t. It’s misogynistic of us! A long pause.
What if I don’t use my hands?
(impressed, whispered) You can make yourself come using only your mind? That’s like the one thing my mind can’t do!
No! I use...other stuff. Molly follows Amy’s eyes to her bookshelf.
A book?! That's very Freudian. But I’d worry about paper cuts.
No! Like, something soft. Can we please stop talking about this? Molly eyes a couple of stuffed animals on Amy’s shelf.
The alligator? Reveal a cute fuzzy ALLIGATOR with a long, phallic snout.
No. Can we just--
The dog?
Stop. My grandma got me that right before she died.
Just tell me what--
The panda, okay? Whatever. (CONTINUED )
Molly eyes an innocent-looking panda bear on the shelf. I missing an eye.
What happened to his eye?
(quickly) That fell off way before anything happened with us.
Does he talk dirty? Tell you how he’s endangered?
Stop!

You are such a sneaky bitch! I can’t believe I didn’t know you’ve been mounting that old fuzzy panda every night! (then) Honestly, it’s kinda exhilarating. I thought we knew everything about each other. It’s probably healthy for a relationship to have a secret, and now we have one. Amy nods a little too quickly, but Molly doesn’t notice. MOLLY (CONT’D) Do I have any? I once tried to masturbate with an electric toothbrush but I just got a terrible UTI.

I wish that had been a secret, but you’ve mentioned it many, many times. INT. LIVING ROOM - AMY’S HOUSE - DAY Amy and Molly sneak out of Amy’s room. Amy’s got an overn bag. They’re in puffy coats to hide their outfits.
I need you to do the talking. (CONTINUED )
They round 27.
Why don’t you just tell them we’re going to a party?

They’1l ask too many questions and try to call Nick’s aunt. I’ve never lied to my parents before and you know when I lie I add too many details. Just make up a story. But don’t say we’re having a date night or anything.
Why? It’s funny that your parents think we’re secretly boning.
You’re not the one who has to deal with their creepy smiles when I tell them I’m meeting you at the library. When I am actually meeting you at the library.

At least they support you. I wouldn't have expected that, given their whole...Jesus...thing. It’s nice! the corner to find Amy’s mom CHARMAINE (40s) and father DOUG (40s) preparing dinner in the kitchen.
Heeeeeeeeey. Hil
Charmaine, get to the safe room. We're being robbed by supermodels!
You girls look fabulous! And smart. And also brave.
You guys cold? I'll start a fire, or I‘ll turn up the heat! Get those jackets off, dinner’s almost ready!
Try one of these. I’m calling them “diplo-meatballs.” They’re vegan. (CONTINUED )
Molly steps forward to take one but Amy holds her back.
(sotto to Molly) Nope. We can’t engage.
Char-char, Dougsicle...we were wondering...is it okay if Amy sleeps over at my house? A beat.
The night before graduation?
My mom can take us to the ceremony. We just want more time together before she leaves for Africa.

But we made mushroom-cap-and-gowns. There are special names for all of these things. (pointing to a dish) Chips and Sal-So Long, High School! (pointing to another dish) Cheese and Sala-me, being your dad, was the greatest honor of my life. (pointing to another dish) Melba Toast to your future-- Charmaine grabs his arm and gives him a meaningful look.
But you know what, we get it. We understand. We do. Because what you girls have is very special.
It really is. They say you never forget your first...
Friend.
Special friend.
Normal friend. (CONTINUED )
We're just so grateful we'll have the whole night. To really show each other just how much we care about each other.
That’s great.
Every inch of each other.
(quickly) We'll probably just do a Korean face mask.

I don’t need to know all the words. EXT. AMY’S HOUSE - NIGHT Molly and Amy run outside, zipping off their puffy coats. stuffs them in the overnight bag, tosses the overnight ba into the bushes, and they sprint down the street.

head_text.subj: MORE SOCIAL MEDIA VIDEOS AND PHOTOS

text: QUICK CUTS of PARTY FOOTAGE -- People CHICKEN FIGHT in th pool...a DRUNK GUY bounces off a trampoline and lands in pool with a BELLY FLOP... Two GUYS wearing LAMPSHADES on their heads run and slam into each other like bulls. An audience watches Tanner eats a GHOST PEPPER, then FREAKS
Amy's watching these on her cell as Molly makes phone cal
Oh my God he ate a ghost pepper. He needs milk. Someone get him milk! (then, swiping through) Dude a lot of people are already there.
(hangs up, frowns) Fuck, no one’s answering. (yelling at her phone) Somebody give us the ADDRESS! (CONTINUED )
We've never hung out with any of these people outside of academic activities. They probably think we're calling about school stuff.
You're right. Let’s just call a Lyft.
We still don’t know where we’re going! We’d need a Lyft driver who knows where Nick’s aunt lives. Molly frowns, then gets an idea.
We might have one of those. She dials a number.
Who are you calling?
Don’t worry about it...chica.
What?
A 70’s muscle car rolls up in front of them. The window r down...revealing JARED in the driver’s seat. He is THRILL
All aboard the SS Liiiit! (second-guessing himself) -..as Fuck! The SS Lit as Fuck!
Jesus Christ.
I am so glad you called! Sorry it took me so long, traffic was NERTS-- He scrambles out of the car as Amy glares at Molly. (CONTINUED )
This car is like Guy Fieri’s wet dream.
It’s a means to an end, Amy... Jared overly-suavely opens the door for Molly.
May I offer you the front, Mademoi-- Molly climbs in the back.
Or the back, the back’s even better. Great air flow back there. INT. JARED’S CAR - NIGHT Jared gets in the driver’s seat and grins back at the gir
